alert.note: Alert for Fayette; Marion (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 03 at 5:28AM CDT until August 03 at 6:30AM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 AM CDT THIS MORNING FOR SOUTHERN FAYETTE AND NORTHERN MARION COUNTIES IN SOUTH CENTRAL ILLINOIS... At 528 AM CDT, local law enforcement reported flash flooding due to heavy thunderstorms that moved through the area earlier this morning. Between 3 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. Little to no additional rainfall is expected. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Vandalia, Kinmundy, Mulberry Grove, Farina, Omega, Shobonier, Stephen Forbes Station, Pittsburg, Shafter, St. Peter, Alma, Vernon, St. Paul, Brubaker and Hagerstown. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Illinois near exit 61. Interstate 57 in Illinois between exits 127 and 135. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
